audit.description: The nodev option should be enabled for all removable media.
audit.impact: An attacker could mount a special device (e.g. block or character device) via removable media
audit.remediation: Add the nodev option to the fourth field (mounting options) in /etc/fstab

audit.description: The noexec option should be enabled for all removable media.
audit.impact: An attacker could load executable file via removable media
audit.remediation: Add the noexec option to the fourth field (mounting options) in /etc/fstab

audit.description: The nosuid option should be enabled for all removable media.
audit.impact: An attacker could load files that run with an elevated security context via removable media
audit.remediation: Add the nosuid option to the fourth field (mounting options) in /etc/fstab

audit.description: The nodev/nosuid option should be enabled for all NFS mounts.
audit.impact: An attacker could load files that run with an elevated security context or special devices via remote file system
audit.remediation: Add the nosuid and nodev options to the fourth field (mounting options) in /etc/fstab

audit.description: /etc/passwd file permissions should be 0644
audit.impact: An attacker could modify userIDs and login shells
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r set-etc-passwd-perms'. This will set the permissions and ownership of /etc/passwd

audit.description: /etc/group file permissions should be 0644
audit.impact: An attacker could elevate privileges by modifying group membership
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r set-etc-group-perms'. This will set the permissions and ownership of /etc/group

audit.description: The 'root' group should exist, and contain all members who can su to root
audit.impact: An attacker could escalate permissions by password guessing if su is not restricted to users in the root group.
audit.remediation: Create the root group via the command 'groupadd -g 0 root'

audit.description: There are no accounts without passwords
audit.impact: An attacker can login to accounts with no password and execute arbitrary commands.
audit.remediation: Use the passwd command to set passwords for all accounts

audit.description: Accounts other than root must have unique UIDs greater than zero(0)
audit.impact: If an account other than root has uid zero, an attacker could compromise the account and gain root privileges.
audit.remediation: Assign unique, non-zero uids to all non-root accounts using 'usermod -u'

audit.description: Randomized placement of virtual memory regions should be enabled
audit.impact: An attacker could write executable code to known regions in memory resulting in elevation of privilege
audit.remediation: Add the value '1' or '2' to the file '/proc/sys/kernel/randomize_va_space'

audit.description: Kernel support for the XD/NX processor feature should be enabled
audit.impact: An attacker could cause a system to executable code from data regions in memory resulting in elevation of privilege.
audit.remediation: Confirm the file '/proc/cpuinfo' contains the flag 'nx'

audit.description: IP forwarding should be disabled. (net.ipv4.ip_forward = 0)
audit.impact: An attacker could use this system to perform IP routing functions
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-ip-forward'

audit.description: Accepting source routed packets should be disabled for all interfaces. (net.ipv4.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0)
audit.impact: An attacker could redirect traffic for malicious purposes.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-accept-source-route'

audit.description: Ignoring bogus ICMP responses to broadcasts should be enabled. (net.ipv4.icmp_ignore_bogus_error_responses = 1)
audit.impact: An attacker could perform an ICMP attack resulting in DoS
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-icmp-ignore-bogus-error-responses'

audit.description: Ignoring ICMP echo requests (pings) sent to broadcast / multicast addresses should be enabled. (net.ipv4.icmp_echo_ignore_broadcasts = 1)
audit.impact: An attacker could perform an ICMP attack resulting in DoS
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-icmp-echo-ignore-broadcasts'

audit.description: Performing source validation by reverse path should be enabled for all interfaces. (net.ipv4.conf.all.rp_filter = 1)
audit.impact: The system will accept traffic from addresses that are unroutable.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-rp-filter'

audit.description: Performing source validation by reverse path should be enabled for all interfaces. (net.ipv4.conf.default.rp_filter = 1)
audit.impact: The system will accept traffic from addresses that are unroutable.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-rp-filter'

audit.description: TCP syncookies should be enabled. (net.ipv4.tcp_syncookies = 1)
audit.impact: An attacker could perform a DoS over TCP
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-tcp-syncookies'

audit.description: The system should not act as a network sniffer.
audit.impact: An attacker may use promiscuous interfaces to sniff network traffic
audit.remediation: Promiscuous mode is enabled via a 'promisc' entry in '/etc/network/interfaces' or '/etc/rc.local.' Check both files and remove this entry.

audit.description: All wireless interfaces should be disabled. (disabled)
audit.impact: An attacker could create a fake AP to intercept transmissions.
audit.remediation: Confirm all wireless interfaces are disabled in '/etc/network/interfaces'

audit.description: Disable support for RDS.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a vulnerability in RDS to compromise the system
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-unnecessary-kernel-mods'

audit.description: The syslog or rsyslog package should be installed.
audit.impact: Reliability and security issues will not be logged, preventing proper diagnosis.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r install-syslog'. This will install the rsyslog package

audit.description: The syslog service should be enabled.
audit.impact: Reliability and security issues will not be logged, preventing proper diagnosis.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-syslog'. This will enable and start the syslog service

audit.description: File permissions for all rsyslog log files should be set to 640.
audit.impact: An attacker could cover up activity by manipulating logs
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r configure-syslog-file-create-mode'. This adds the line '$FileCreateMode 0640' to the file '/etc/rsyslog.conf'

audit.description: All rsyslog log files should be owned by the adm group.
audit.impact: An attacker could cover up activity by manipulating logs
audit.remediation: Add the line '$FileGroup adm' to the file '/etc/rsyslog.conf'

audit.description: All rsyslog log files should be owned by the syslog user.
audit.impact: An attacker could cover up activity by manipulating logs
audit.remediation: Add the line '$FileOwner syslog' to the file '/etc/rsyslog.conf'

audit.description: Logs should be sent to a remote loghost (using mdsd service)
audit.impact: An attacker could cover up activity by manipulating logs on the local system
audit.remediation: Start the mdsd service (service mdsd start)

audit.description: Rsyslog should not accept remote messages. (reject)
audit.impact: An attacker could inject messages into syslog, causing a DoS or a distraction from other activity
audit.remediation: Remove the lines '$ModLoad imudp' and '$ModLoad imtcp' from the file '/etc/rsyslog.conf'

audit.description: The logrotate (syslog rotater) service should be enabled. (enabled)
audit.impact: Logfiles could grow unbounded and consume all disk space
audit.remediation: Install the logrotate package and confirm the logrotate cron entry is active (chmod 755 /etc/cron.daily/logrotate; chown root:root /etc/cron.daily/logrotate)

audit.description: The rlogin service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could gain access, bypassing strict authentication requirements
audit.remediation: Remove the inetd service.

audit.description: The telnet service should be disabled. (disabled)
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack unencrypted telnet sessions
audit.remediation: Remove or comment out the telnet entry in the file '/etc/inetd.conf'

audit.description: All telnetd packages should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack unencrypted telnet sessions
audit.remediation: Uninstall any telnetd packages

audit.description: The rcp/rsh service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack unencrypted sessions
audit.remediation: Remove or comment out the shell entry in the file '/etc/inetd.conf'

audit.description: The rsh-server package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack unencrypted rsh sessions
audit.remediation: Uninstall the rsh-server package (apt-get remove rsh-server)

audit.description: The readahead-fedora package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: No substantial exposure, but also no substantial benefit
audit.remediation: Uninstall the readahead-fedora package (apt-get remove readahead-fedora)

audit.description: The bluetooth/hidd service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could intercept or manipulate wireless communications.
audit.remediation: Uninstall the bluetooth package (apt-get remove bluetooth)

audit.description: The isdn service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a modem to gain unauthorized access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the isdnutils-base package (apt-get remove isdnutils-base)

audit.description: The isdnutils-base package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a modem to gain unauthorized access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the isdnutils-base package (apt-get remove isdnutils-base)

audit.description: The kdump service should be disabled. (disabled)
audit.impact: An attacker could analyze a previous system crash to retrieve sensitive information
audit.remediation: Uninstall the kdump-tools package (apt-get remove kdump-tools)

audit.description: Zeroconf networking should be disabled. (disabled)
audit.impact: An attacker could use abuse this to gain information on network systems, or spoof DNS requests due to flaws in its trust model
audit.remediation: Remove any 'ipv4ll' entries in the file '/etc/network/interfaces'

audit.description: The crond service should be enabled. (enabled)
audit.impact: Cron is required by almost all systems for regular maintenance tasks
audit.remediation: Install the cron package (apt-get install -y cron) and confirm the file '/etc/init/cron.conf' contains the line 'start on runlevel [2345]'

audit.description: File permissions for /etc/anacrontab should be set to root:root 600.
audit.impact: An attacker could manipulate this file to prevent scheduled tasks or execute malicious tasks
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r fix-anacrontab-perms'. This sets the ownership and permissions on /etc/anacrontab

audit.description: SSH must be configured and managed to meet best practices. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config Protocol = 2'
audit.impact: An attacker could use flaws in an earlier version of the SSH protocol to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r configure-ssh-protocol'. This will set 'Protocol 2' in the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: SSH must be configured and managed to meet best practices. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config IgnoreRhosts = yes'
audit.impact: An attacker could use flaws in the Rhosts protocol to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r enable-ssh-ignore-rhosts'. This will add the line 'IgnoreRhosts yes' to the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: Emulation of the rsh command through the ssh server should be disabled. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config RhostsRSAAuthentication = no'
audit.impact: An attacker could use flaws in the RHosts protocol to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-ssh-rhost-rsa-auth'. This will add the line 'RhostsRSAAuthentication no' to the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: SSH host-based authentication should be disabled. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config HostbasedAuthentication = no'
audit.impact: An attacker could use use host-based authentication to gain access from a compromised host
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-ssh-host-based-auth'. This will add the line 'HostbasedAuthentication no' to the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config PermitEmptyPasswords = no'
audit.impact: An attacker could gain access through password guessing
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-ssh-empty-passwords'. This will add the line 'PermitEmptyPasswords no' to the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: Users are not allowed to set environment options for SSH.
audit.impact: An attacker may be able to bypass some access restrictions over SSH
audit.remediation: Remove the line 'PermitUserEnvironment yes' from the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'

audit.description: The avahi-daemon service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a vulnerability in the avahi daemon to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-avahi-daemon'. This will disable the avahi-daemon service

audit.description: The cups service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a flaw in the cups service to elevate privileges
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-cups'. This will disable the cups service

audit.description: The dhcpd service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use dhcpd to provide faulty information to clients, interfering with normal operation.
audit.remediation: Remove the isc-dhcp-server package (apt-get remove isc-dhcp-server)

audit.description: The isc-dhcp-server package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use dhcpd to provide faulty information to clients, interfering with normal operation.
audit.remediation: Remove the isc-dhcp-server package (apt-get remove isc-dhcp-server)

audit.description: The rpcgssd service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a flaw in rpcgssd/nfs to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-rpcgssd'. This will disable the rpcgssd service.

audit.description: The rpcidmapd service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a flaw in idmapd/nfs to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-rpcidmapd'. This will disable the rpcidmapd service.

audit.description: The portmap service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a flaw in portmap to gain access
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-rpcbind'. This will disable the rpcbind service.

audit.description: The rpcsvcgssd service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use a flaw in rpcsvcgssd to gain access
audit.remediation: Remove the line 'NEED_SVCGSSD = yes' from the file '/etc/inetd.conf'

audit.description: Kernels should only be compiled from approved sources.
audit.impact: A kernel from an unapproved source could contain vulnerabilities or backdoors to grant access to an attacker.
audit.remediation: Install the kernel that is provided by your distro vendor.

audit.description: The IPv6 protocol should be enabled.
audit.impact: This is necessary for communication on modern networks.
audit.remediation: Open /etc/sysctl.conf and confirm that 'net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6' and 'net.ipv6.conf.default.disable_ipv6' are set to 0

audit.description: Disable inetd unless required. (inetd)
audit.impact: An attacker could exploit a vulnerability in an inetd service to gain access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the inetd service (apt-get remove inetd)

audit.description: Disable xinetd unless required. (xinetd)
audit.impact: An attacker could exploit a vulnerability in an xinetd service to gain access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the inetd service (apt-get remove xinetd)

audit.description: Install inetd only if appropriate and required by your distro. Secure according to current hardening standards. (if required)
audit.impact: An attacker could exploit a vulnerability in an inetd service to gain access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the inetd service (apt-get remove inetd)

audit.description: Install xinetd only if appropriate and required by your distro. Secure according to current hardening standards. (if required)
audit.impact: An attacker could exploit a vulnerability in an xinetd service to gain access
audit.remediation: Uninstall the inetd service (apt-get remove xinetd)

audit.description: The ypbind service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could retrieve sensitive information from the ypbind service
audit.remediation: Uninstall the nis package (apt-get remove nis)

audit.description: The nis package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could retrieve sensitive information from the NIS service
audit.remediation: Uninstall the nis package (apt-get remove nis)

audit.description: The tftp service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack an unencrypted session
audit.remediation: Remove the tftp entry from the file '/etc/inetd.conf'

audit.description: The tftpd package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could eavesdrop or highjack an unencrypted session
audit.remediation: Uninstall the tftpd package (apt-get remove tftpd)

audit.description: The sendmail package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use this system to send emails with malicious content to other users
audit.remediation: Uninstall the sendmail package (apt-get remove sendmail)

audit.description: The postfix package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use this system to send emails with malicious content to other users
audit.remediation: Uninstall the postfix package (apt-get remove postfix)

audit.description: Postfix network listening should be disabled as appropriate.
audit.impact: An attacker could use this system to send emails with malicious content to other users
audit.remediation: Add the line 'inet_interfaces localhost' to the file '/etc/postfix/main.cf'

audit.description: The ldap service should be disabled. (disabled)
audit.impact: An attacker could manipulate the LDAP service on this host to distribute false data to LDAP clients
audit.remediation: Uninstall the slapd package (apt-get remove slapd)

audit.description: The named service should be disabled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use the DNS service to distribute false data to clients
audit.remediation: Uninstall the bind9 package (apt-get remove bind9)

audit.description: The bind package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: An attacker could use the DNS service to distribute false data to clients
audit.remediation: Uninstall the bind9 package (apt-get remove bind9)

audit.description: The dovecot service should be disabled.
audit.impact: The system could be used as an IMAP/POP3 server
audit.remediation: Uninstall the dovecot-core package (apt-get remove dovecot-core)

audit.description: The dovecot package should be uninstalled.
audit.impact: The system could be used as an IMAP/POP3 server
audit.remediation: Uninstall the dovecot-core package (apt-get remove dovecot-core)

audit.description: Remove unnecesary packages
Remove unnecesary accounts
audit.impact: For compliance
audit.remediation: Remove the unnecesary accounts

audit.description: Accepting source routed packets should be disabled for all interfaces. (net.ipv6.conf.all.accept_source_route = 0)
audit.impact: An attacker could redirect traffic for malicious purposes.
audit.remediation: Run the command '/usr/local/bin/azsecd remediate -r disable-accept-source-route'

audit.description: SSH must be configured and managed to meet best practices. - '/etc/ssh/sshd_config RhostsAuthentication = no'
audit.impact: An attacker could use flaws in the RHosts protocol to gain access
audit.remediation: Remove the line 'RhostsAuthentication yes' from the file '/etc/ssh/sshd_config'
